I didn't quite answer your question. Yes, you could use a media center to do a wireless copy of the files unto your PS3 as well.

Actually, it was me who failed to give you enough information.

Allow me to elaborate.  

I have a nice, spacious hard drive on my PS3 already which will easily accommodate 45 GB.  Since Rome is my favorite show of all time, this is a no brainer. 

What I was wondering is how I need to transfer these.

Say for example I fire up PS3 media server.  Do I need to transfer just the MTS file (I'm assuming that's the episode itself) to my PS3, or do I need all the smaller files on the hard drive?

It's fine either way.  I've watched this show through its entire run about 8 times, and I still put in on every single night to relive the greatest moments.  A magnificent piece of television, and I'm glad you found it worthwhile to upload it.

I'll be honest with you, I've never tried doing it without all the additional files, but I will hazard a guess and say that they are necessary. Once you put the episode on the PS3, either through your media server (Which I'm not sure if you know but takes muuuuch longer than using an external hard drive), or through an external hard drive, you will find the episode in the stream folder. 
Like you said though, uploading this one was a no-brainer. Any from the list above that you'd be interested in seeing first? 
As for me, I'm just happy to be doing my part. Long live the pirates, after all.

I'm sure any of those would be met with praise, and look gorgeous.

People would likely prefer the TV series over the movies, since they're more difficult to find in HD.

However, those take much longer.

I don't think there's a wrong choice.  Just pick the one you like the best.  You're doing us a huge favor.

I don't know if this information is particularly valuable, since it's just speculation on my part.  Forgive my ignorance if I'm totally wrong.

Based on the folders this torrent produces, I find it somewhat unlikely that the MTS video file (which the PS3 does read) is dependent upon the other files.

Here's my reasoning.  There are 9 files for each episode, one of which is obviously the one that plays.  However, they're located in different folders.  

Now, if these files were inseparable, I would assume the software in the PS3 would also have to discern what's in which folder.  From what I gather, the PS3 has its own video folder that is required to store a file in to play natively.

Therefore, if the MTS file plays natively, it's unlikely that it needs the other files, unless I'm just completely misunderstanding how the PS3 reads files.

Second, the other folder names are "backup", clipinfo", and "playlist", none of which sound essential to playing back the file.

The most compelling evidence of all is how small the other files are.  If they were video, they'd be bigger.  If they were audio, they'd be bigger.  

These files probably work to make a burnable Blu-Ray that will display the episode guide and other features of the disc.  However, I am skeptical as to whether they are essential for the MTS files to run.  I could be wrong though.

I'll tell you right away once these finish downloading.  Man I love this series.
